circumstances: While in cruising altitude from Cape Eleuthera to Nassau, both engines failed. The pilot reduced his altitude and eventually ditched the airplane off Ship Channel Cay, Exuma. The pilot was rescued while the airplane sank and was lost.
probable_cause:
Double engine failure in normal cruise due to inadequate preflight preparation. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Mismanagement of fuel, 
- Fuel exhaustion, 
- Fuel quantity gauge, erratic,
- Aircraft came to rest in water, 
- Forced landing off airport in water.
